Our unique approach leverages 50+ years of learning science, cutting-edge data analytics and high-performance life skills coaching. In doing so, we can help students learn 5x faster and unlock their full potential in both academics and in life. We are a remote-first company that hires globally via Crossover.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $15 USD/hour, which equates to $30,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next: You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us: First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

CERP is a leading independent social impact organisation focused on improving decision making through rigorous research, advanced analytics, capacity building, data collection and advisory services. It strives to deepen the culture of evidence across public and private sectors, inspire innovation, drive impact and improve lives.Project and Position DescriptionThe Infant Feeding Project at CERP primarily aims to conduct a Randomized Controlled Trial to evaluate an intervention involving a mHealth tool and associated training targeting community-based Lady Health Workers (LHWs) to increase WHO-recommended breastfeeding practices in rural Pakistan. In its current phase, the project involves the designing and development of the said intervention which provides decision-making support and educational tools to LHWs on breastfeeding in order to ultimately improve infant and child health outcomes. The project’s scope may also include additional studies related to LHWs and maternal and child health care in the future.The Principal Investigators (PIs) on the project are: Dr. Erica Field (Duke University), Dr. Katherine Vyborny (Duke University), Dr. Nicola Singletary (University of North Carolina), Dr. Laila Ladak (Aga Khan University), Ms. Zohra Kurji (Aga Khan University), Ms. Zahra Shaheen (formerly Aga Khan University). The project involves working closely with Principal Investigators and partner organizations, including those in the provincial health departments, to design and implement the project.CERP is recruiting a Research Assistant for a full-time role based at the CERP office in Lahore (including possible travel to rural areas around Lahore for fieldwork). CERP’s project teams are small, and the amount of work we accomplish is significant. The Research Assistant will be reporting to the Program Manager and the PIs.  Job description and responsibilities:● Support execution of quantitative and qualitative research activities on the ground, including interviews, focus group discussions and surveys● Design and develop data collection protocols and instruments, and data sharing protocols with government partners● Coordinate and work closely with the team tasked with developing the mHealth software application and other partners to ensure timely and satisfactory development, testing, and rollout of the application.● Clean and analyze raw survey data and other project data sets for analysis; assist in conducting data analysis● Conduct quality checks on survey activities and prepare visualizations/descriptives as necessary● Contribute to internal and external communications to disseminate research findings including briefs, blogs, reports, and presentations.● Conduct desk research and prepare drafts for stakeholders deliverables.● Develop and update project documentation regularly.● Support development and submission of IRB protocols, renewals, and amendments. Requirements:● Bachelor’s degree in economics, or public policy from an internationally recognized university● Strong understanding of research methods and familiarity with randomized trials● Strong written and oral communication and interpersonal skills; should be able to communicate with a wide variety of stakeholders in the government and private sectors, donors as well as academics● Experience and willingness to clean/manage data and perform analysis in STATA● Knowledge and interest in the design and use of digital interventions/ human-tech interaction ● Experience of working on health-related research projects is preferred● Experience in using SurveyCTO or a similar program for survey design is desired● Excellent organizational skills, detail-oriented, and ability to work both independently and collaboratively● Ability to work under time pressure and solve problems creatively● Fluent in English and Urdu. Conversational knowledge of Punjabi is preferred

We support a new wave of e-commerce entrepreneurs and the global shift towards local and more sustainable production.In many ways, we at Gelato are rethinking how digital fabrication of customized products can be done on-demand. Just imagine what will happen when we add 3D printing capabilities to this global service. We are already empowering thousands of e-commerce entrepreneurs to grow and scale their businesses.Gelato EngineeringWe own no physical production assets, nor servers, instead our asset is a cloud based connectivity platform that enables world-class on-demand production for e-commerce platforms and applications. This engineered platform needs to provide our customers access to more than 130 production partners in 32 countries and includes production plate design, routing to an appropriate partner, finally linking to logistics’ systems for delivery to the consumer. All this in 72 hours and reaching more than 5 billion people and potential consumers in a smarter, faster, and greener way.We have a multicultural Engineering team of 120 plus people working in 5 countries who build, grow and maintain our applications and platform. Our engineering landscape provides the technology to extend our capabilities and features across a couple of customer-facing applications: Optimalprint and Gelato API plus the digital connectivity platform. The employed technologies range from backends using PHP and GoLang to mobile apps built natively or with hybrid technology, running on cloud services and with a modern CI/CD pipeline.Have a look at more on Engineering at Gelato here: https://careers.gelato.com/pages/engineeringWhat you will be doing Using the latest technologies to solve real problems for our customers at a massive scaleCollaborating closely with other engineers as a valuable member of a cross-functional teamSharing your knowledge and building creative solutions while helping the team evolve best practicesDesigning, developing, and deploying backend services with a focus on high availability, low latency, and scalabilityTaking end-to-end responsibility for the services that are owned by your team, including taking part in an on-call rotation
Who you are A minimum of B.S. degree in Information Technology or Computer Science or 5+ years in a similar positionAble to adapt, change and grow quickly as we scale the organizationPassionate about engineering practices like agile, continuous delivery, test-driven development, traceability, and observabilityGrowth mentality, are curious and not afraid to be experimental.You share your ideas and continuously improve yourself and the team around youSolid experience as an Engineer designing, developing, and maintaining API driven solutionsStrong communication skills, high integrity, and great attention to detail
You’ll get to work with: Docker and KubernetesPHP (Symfony) and/or GoLangMicroservices architecturePostgreSQL, Elastic search, RabbitMQMemcache, RedisELK, Jaeger, Prometheus & Grafana
What we offerWe offer you a chance to be part of a truly amazing journey in a company that sets very high targets and works hard to achieve them. You will be able to work with smart, motivated, and engaged co-workers from all over the world, in an intense and very energetic environment. This leads to you having a tangible impact on the way that we operate and expand our business.Some of the highlights of the package include: Strong technical culture of continuous innovation and improvementChance to become a shareholder of Gelato!Flexible holidays, swap days off according to your values, beliefs and needs.Get paid in international currencyAnd much much more!

Job Desception:
About the job
            

 
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?At Trilogy, we're convinced that generative AI represents the future of coding. We see tools like Copilot, Cursor, and Code Interpreter as game-changers in the software industry, much like the Internet and Cloud Computing once were. Our vision is that significant portions of code that are written today tediously by hand will be mostly automated away by using generative AI.Why does this matter? Because with AI, you'll not only speed up the process of understanding and writing code but also produce standardized solutions, implement features more efficiently, experiment faster, and streamline testing. We believe developers working with this model will have a more rewarding job; they'll cover a broader scope and accomplish more in the same amount of time.This role is unique in our company. While our other engineering roles focus primarily on feature delivery, this position emphasizes developing a methodology for leveraging AI tools and patterns within the engineering process. The processes and methods you establish will benefit others, as they will be reused across teams.Besides this novel approach for your day-to-day work, you’ll also get a chance to work on some really exciting products: Crossover - an AI-powered hiring platform that sifts through millions of applicants per year to find the top 1% of global remote talent.gt.school - an online education platform that uses advanced data collection, algorithms, and AI-generated content to empower students to learn at their own pace.Data-driven Sales - an initiative that leverages data and AI algorithms to streamline the sales process across a portfolio of over 100 software products.
We're on the brink of an exhilarating journey with generative AI, and we want you to be a part of it. If you're eager to pioneer this transformation and play a pivotal role in the AI-driven future of software development, Trilogy is the place for you.What You Will Be Doing Proposing and conducting experiments with generative AI to enhance engineering processes, including problem decomposition, solution design, code generation, and advanced troubleshooting.Documenting best practices and techniques in playbooks and guides that enable others to harness the power of generative AI effectively.Using AI tools and techniques to develop and roll out actual features and products.Adopting, testing, and aggressively integrating new technologies, and standardizing a tech stack that genuinely boosts productivity.
What You Won’t Be Doing Developing completely new AI models - we are focusing our attention on reusing and/or finetuning existing models instead. Engaging in academic exercises without tangible outcomes or failing to deliver features and products.Getting stuck on a stagnant tech stack that neither changes nor innovates.
Basic RequirementsArtificial Intelligence Engineer key responsibilities Minimum 5 years of experience in software development.Minimum 3 years as a primary technical contributor for a development team or software product.Extensive hands-on experience using generative AI for software engineering tasks or in a product you built.
About TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $100 USD/hour, which equates to $200,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next: You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us: First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

Job Desception:
About the job
            

 
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?At Trilogy, we're convinced that generative AI represents the future of coding. We see tools like Copilot, Cursor, and Code Interpreter as game-changers in the software industry, much like the Internet and Cloud Computing once were. Our vision is that significant portions of code that are written today tediously by hand will be mostly automated away by using generative AI.Why does this matter? Because with AI, you'll not only speed up the process of understanding and writing code but also produce standardized solutions, implement features more efficiently, experiment faster, and streamline testing. We believe developers working with this model will have a more rewarding job; they'll cover a broader scope and accomplish more in the same amount of time.This role is unique in our company. While our other engineering roles focus primarily on feature delivery, this position emphasizes developing a methodology for leveraging AI tools and patterns within the engineering process. The processes and methods you establish will benefit others, as they will be reused across teams.Besides this novel approach for your day-to-day work, you’ll also get a chance to work on some really exciting products: Crossover - an AI-powered hiring platform that sifts through millions of applicants per year to find the top 1% of global remote talent.gt.school - an online education platform that uses advanced data collection, algorithms, and AI-generated content to empower students to learn at their own pace.Data-driven Sales - an initiative that leverages data and AI algorithms to streamline the sales process across a portfolio of over 100 software products.
We're on the brink of an exhilarating journey with generative AI, and we want you to be a part of it. If you're eager to pioneer this transformation and play a pivotal role in the AI-driven future of software development, Trilogy is the place for you.What You Will Be Doing Proposing and conducting experiments with generative AI to enhance engineering processes, including problem decomposition, solution design, code generation, and advanced troubleshooting.Documenting best practices and techniques in playbooks and guides that enable others to harness the power of generative AI effectively.Using AI tools and techniques to develop and roll out actual features and products.Adopting, testing, and aggressively integrating new technologies, and standardizing a tech stack that genuinely boosts productivity.
What You Won’t Be Doing Developing completely new AI models - we are focusing our attention on reusing and/or finetuning existing models instead. Engaging in academic exercises without tangible outcomes or failing to deliver features and products.Getting stuck on a stagnant tech stack that neither changes nor innovates.
Basic RequirementsAI Super Engineer key responsibilities Minimum 5 years of experience in software development.Minimum 3 years as a primary technical contributor for a development team or software product.Extensive hands-on experience using generative AI for software engineering tasks or in a product you built.
About TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $100 USD/hour, which equates to $200,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next: You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us: First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

Project Management  Manages individual projects or components of large projects, schedules, deliverables and coordinates with subject matter experts internally and external customers Participates in project activities and meetings, understands dependencies, and manages timelines, schedules & risks Drive all project requirements through demand planning tools (Kinaxis) including order processing and schedule management with Client and Internal changes.  Stakeholder Management  Develop deep knowledge and understanding of customer and stakeholder business and needs Build strong relationships with customer operations stakeholders. Be the main point of contact for customer operational requirements. Effectively identify, define, document and manage stakeholder expectations and communications to ensure customer measurable customer satisfaction

Process  Project Management  Organize and conduct regular reviews to ensure sufficient progress vs. project objectives Set and drive agenda, roles and expectations per project to ensure all responsibilities are being met; escalate non-performance issues as appropriate Partner with sales and supply chain on inventory requirements and health. Accountable for inventory related risks and liability.
 Demand Planning and Analytics  Map existing workflows and processes to highlight needed improvements according to customer specific requirements Assess project category by size and complexity. Define project requirements for demand planning. Mine available data to quantify and illustrate impacts of current processes
 Implementation  Identify project requirements and conduct project start up sessions to onboard project requirements and deliverables. Partner with internal and external stakeholders to develop means for operationalizing change recommendations  Be able to identify scope changes and driver Project Change Requests (PCR) to support scope changes. Install QA/QC metrics and checks to monitor success of changes vs. expectations
 Communication  Effectively communicate project requirements, schedules and timelines. Collaborate with project coordinators on schedule inputs into project tools (Kinaxis) and manage order entry according to schedule. Develop and distribute recurring updates indicating status vs. objectives for each project Where appropriate, partner to develop change management communications strategy to keep stakeholders informed of coming changes as well as performance expectations

Metrics 100% utilization of project tools for project demand inputs Accountable for project inventory management and associated risk. Successful management of project scope, budget and scheduled to ensure timely completion of project initiativesEnsure that 100% of all tasks are resolved within appropriate time constraints through proper task managementProvide weekly status report depicting: Project StatusRisksIssue Mitigation

Education/Certification  Bachelor’s degree in Business or a related field, or equivalent experience;  Formal Project Management training
Required Experience  1 - 3 years of experience in program/ project management, process engineering or strategy within a technology or operations environment Experience managing projects, coordinating with stakeholders and defining measure project deliverables Problem solving skills: must be able to identify risks and develop actionable mitigation plans Analytical skills: must be highly analytical with experience in using objective data to drive strategic recommendations Communications skills: must be able to concisely explain complex issues, communicate well in writing and verbally, and be able to build strong working relationships across all levels of the organization, including remote areas Intellectual curiosity: must possess a desire to understand why/how things work vs. simply completing the task at hand Knowledge of and experience using Project Management Software Possesses strong Microsoft Office skills including Excel, Word, Outlook and PowerPoint
TIMINGS:2:00pm to 10:30pmZones Offers a Comprehensive Benefits PackageOur employees enjoy a variety of comprehensive benefits, including health Insurance coverage for parents, spouse & children, life insurance, Gratuity, and EOBI. OverviewWe are looking for some incredible people who can help us bring a change in the world of RCM. This position often involves overseeing the end-to-end revenue cycle, from patient registration to collections.. You must be adaptable and versatile since you will be responsible for many tasks.Responsibilities Ensure the accurate collection of patient data, including insurance details, and validate the same against services to be rendered.Oversee the entry of charges for medical services provided in pain management and orthopedic care.Utilize ICD-10, CPT, and HCPCS codes to correctly identify diagnoses and procedures for billing.Handle the submission of clean claims to insurance companies, whether electronically or manually, in a timely manner.Manage the accurate posting of payments received from insurance companies and patients to the respective accounts.Track outstanding claims, and manage follow-up actions including calls and correspondence with insurance companies.Evaluate denied claims, identify issues, and implement corrective actions, including appeals.Ensure adherence to federal and state billing regulations, including HIPAA, as well as any specific compliance requirements in pain management and orthopedics.Produce regular reports to highlight the financial health, such as outstanding AR, denial rates, and reimbursement rates, of the pain management and orthopedic practices.Oversee, train, and support the billing team, keeping them updated on coding changes, compliance requirements, and best practices.Ensure all activities in accordance with companywide information security policies and procedures as per ISO 27001 and 9001 requirements.

If you want to build your career around one of the biggest support services providers organizations in Lahore in healthcare industry then, we are what you are looking for!What Makes You A Good Fit For This Job?This job requires you to be a savvy listener and someone who is agile enough to settle in a fast-paced environment. If you are nodding your head so far, then you are a perfect fit for this job! Additional certification in medical billing and coding is highly beneficial.Extensive experience in healthcare revenue cycle management, with specific focus on pain management and/or orthopedics.Familiarity with billing software and electronic health records (EHR) systems.Strong communication skills for liaising with insurance companies, healthcare providers, and internal team.Up-to-date knowledge of billing regulations, coding updates, and compliance standards pertinent to pain management and orthopedics.
Learning and Takeaway:Here @ MMH we will help build you!• Unlimited exposure.• A chance to polish your skills.• A great learning environment.• Ample experience to build a future path for yourself.• An opportunity to operate with a highly trained and diversified network of people.Perks:• Health Insurance• Gratuity• Medical and casual leaves• Annual leaves• On job training• Two days off in a week• Annual Increment• Loan facility• Employee Appreciation programsWhat You Can Expect After ApplyingOnce you've applied, sit back, and relax while we get to work on our side! Job Desception:
About the job
            

 
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?At Trilogy, we're convinced that generative AI represents the future of coding. We see tools like Copilot, Cursor, and Code Interpreter as game-changers in the software industry, much like the Internet and Cloud Computing once were. Our vision is that significant portions of code that are written today tediously by hand will be mostly automated away by using generative AI.Why does this matter? Because with AI, you'll not only speed up the process of understanding and writing code but also produce standardized solutions, implement features more efficiently, experiment faster, and streamline testing. We believe developers working with this model will have a more rewarding job; they'll cover a broader scope and accomplish more in the same amount of time.This role is unique in our company. While our other engineering roles focus primarily on feature delivery, this position emphasizes developing a methodology for leveraging AI tools and patterns within the engineering process. The processes and methods you establish will benefit others, as they will be reused across teams.Besides this novel approach for your day-to-day work, you’ll also get a chance to work on some really exciting products: Crossover - an AI-powered hiring platform that sifts through millions of applicants per year to find the top 1% of global remote talent.gt.school - an online education platform that uses advanced data collection, algorithms, and AI-generated content to empower students to learn at their own pace.Data-driven Sales - an initiative that leverages data and AI algorithms to streamline the sales process across a portfolio of over 100 software products.
We're on the brink of an exhilarating journey with generative AI, and we want you to be a part of it. If you're eager to pioneer this transformation and play a pivotal role in the AI-driven future of software development, Trilogy is the place for you.What You Will Be Doing Proposing and conducting experiments with generative AI to enhance engineering processes, including problem decomposition, solution design, code generation, and advanced troubleshooting.Documenting best practices and techniques in playbooks and guides that enable others to harness the power of generative AI effectively.Using AI tools and techniques to develop and roll out actual features and products.Adopting, testing, and aggressively integrating new technologies, and standardizing a tech stack that genuinely boosts productivity.
What You Won’t Be Doing Developing completely new AI models - we are focusing our attention on reusing and/or finetuning existing models instead. Engaging in academic exercises without tangible outcomes or failing to deliver features and products.Getting stuck on a stagnant tech stack that neither changes nor innovates.
Basic RequirementsSoftware Engineer (AI-Powered Development) key responsibilities Minimum 5 years of experience in software development.Minimum 3 years as a primary technical contributor for a development team or software product.Extensive hands-on experience using generative AI for software engineering tasks or in a product you built.
About TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $100 USD/hour, which equates to $200,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next: You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us: First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

Job Desception:
About the job
            

 
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?At Trilogy, we're convinced that generative AI represents the future of coding. We see tools like Copilot, Cursor, and Code Interpreter as game-changers in the software industry, much like the Internet and Cloud Computing once were. Our vision is that significant portions of code that are written today tediously by hand will be mostly automated away by using generative AI.Why does this matter? Because with AI, you'll not only speed up the process of understanding and writing code but also produce standardized solutions, implement features more efficiently, experiment faster, and streamline testing. We believe developers working with this model will have a more rewarding job; they'll cover a broader scope and accomplish more in the same amount of time.This role is unique in our company. While our other engineering roles focus primarily on feature delivery, this position emphasizes developing a methodology for leveraging AI tools and patterns within the engineering process. The processes and methods you establish will benefit others, as they will be reused across teams.Besides this novel approach for your day-to-day work, you’ll also get a chance to work on some really exciting products: Crossover - an AI-powered hiring platform that sifts through millions of applicants per year to find the top 1% of global remote talent.gt.school - an online education platform that uses advanced data collection, algorithms, and AI-generated content to empower students to learn at their own pace.Data-driven Sales - an initiative that leverages data and AI algorithms to streamline the sales process across a portfolio of over 100 software products.
We're on the brink of an exhilarating journey with generative AI, and we want you to be a part of it. If you're eager to pioneer this transformation and play a pivotal role in the AI-driven future of software development, Trilogy is the place for you.What You Will Be Doing Proposing and conducting experiments with generative AI to enhance engineering processes, including problem decomposition, solution design, code generation, and advanced troubleshooting.Documenting best practices and techniques in playbooks and guides that enable others to harness the power of generative AI effectively.Using AI tools and techniques to develop and roll out actual features and products.Adopting, testing, and aggressively integrating new technologies, and standardizing a tech stack that genuinely boosts productivity.
What You Won’t Be Doing Developing completely new AI models - we are focusing our attention on reusing and/or finetuning existing models instead. Engaging in academic exercises without tangible outcomes or failing to deliver features and products.Getting stuck on a stagnant tech stack that neither changes nor innovates.
Basic RequirementsAI-Augmented Software Developer key responsibilities Minimum 5 years of experience in software development.Minimum 3 years as a primary technical contributor for a development team or software product.Extensive hands-on experience using generative AI for software engineering tasks or in a product you built.
About TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $100 USD/hour, which equates to $200,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next: You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us: First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

What we offer: The opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies, including the latest in AWS serverless and no-code/low-code patterns.The opportunity to learn and experiment with using generative AI to boost your productivity.A team of exceptionally talented engineers from around the world as your peers.The chance to work on products that are reshaping industries and making a difference in people's lives.

We're at the start of a thrilling journey with generative AI, experimenting and learning to fully leverage its potential and free our engineers from mundane tasks, allowing them to focus on what truly matters: design, decision-making, and understanding the far-reaching implications of different implementation strategies.Showcase your skills, not just your resume. Take on our challenges: 15-min Cognitive, 90-min Coding, 120-min Technical Decision-Making. Excel and you'll face a decisive interview with our Hiring Manager. More than half walk away with an offer. Ready to unleash your potential? Apply today!What You Will Be Doing Developing cloud-native backends and implementing data processing algorithms using the latest serverless cloud patterns, including AWS.Review code to ensure adherence to best practices, team standards, and customer requirements.

Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?In a tech landscape where JavaScript and Python cast long shadows, we at Trilogy champion the enduring power of C++. We're looking for professionals who navigated through the evolution of this powerful language, having used decades-old techstacks across multiple companies and projects when they were state of the art.At Trilogy, an influential force in the software industry powering 100+ B2B SaaS products, we acknowledge the resilience of seasoned developers like you. Our products are carefully architected using simple, modular, high-quality code and cutting-edge AWS technologies, and we are on a mission to build many more. You will be a top-level contributor focusing purely on the technical aspects, transforming legacy on-prem products into efficient cloud-native solutions, and architecting new cloud-based engines from scratch. You will operate in a dynamic environment equipped with the necessary documentation and cloud-based development and test tools, liberating you from the infrastructure burdens so you can devote more energy to the core development work.This is the perfect opportunity if you're a C++ veteran with wide-ranging experience, and a robust problem-solving approach, who can thrive in a high-pressure environment. Join us in this challenging venture, push your potential to its limits, and redefine what's possible in the software development realm!What You Will Be Doing Modernizing legacy products, leveraging your skills to spearhead their transformation into cloud-native solutions.Applying your expertise to unravel and solve complex implementation challenges by making the appropriate technical decisions.Playing a crucial role in our software's functionality and reliability, identifying and permanently fixing bugs and defects.Upholding our commitment to excellence by reviewing code from other developers, ensuring it meets our quality bars and prevents potential regressions.
What You Won’t Be Doing Working on a single product: Our engineers handle multiple codebases and technologies and work on multiple releases every year.Mindless code writing: Every code change must consider architectural implications.Managing projects or tasks: We have automated management overhead so you can focus entirely on software development.

Upon submitting an application, candidates will receive an email from career.place, prompting them to go through the anonymous screening. We encourage candidates of all abilities, ages, gender identities and expressions, national origins, races and ethnicities, religious beliefs, and sexual orientations to apply. Our vision is love brands, done sustainably, for a better shared future. Our manufacturing teams are dedicated to bringing our brands to life and creating value for our customers, big and small. The Maintenance Officer role provides maintenance support to our plant operations to enable us to meet our quality standards, safety codes, and ensures we are executing our maintenance programs. The Maintenance Officer must identify, troubleshoot, and repair problems (mechanical, electrical, etc.), run tests, isolate problems, remove/replace failed components, determine failure modes by studying worn components, and perform other tasks, as required. This is a great career for someone that has maintenance experience and wants to work for one of the world’s most admired companies.What You’ll Do For Us Performs skilled maintenance and repair services of facility or/and production plant systems such as mechanical, electrical and building or/and production line systems. Plans and conducts building repairs such as repair outdoor lighting, doors, drywall, and ceiling tiles. Installs insulation and plastic coverings on product lines and piping, perform light plumbing and repairs. Performs facility preventative maintenance programs as directed. Disassembles machinery and equipment to remove parts and make repairs, examines parts for defects such as breakage and excessive wear. Cleans, lubricates, and adjusts parts, equipment, and machinery. Perform preventative maintenance and clear jams on machines as neededPerforms building maintenance and troubleshooting to meet or exceed plant and departmental goals while ensuring tasks are completed in a safe manner to ensure achievement of Quality, Service, Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) and Cost Objectives. Complies with all standard operating procedures and requirements under CCR Quality System. Directs and tracks contractor needs, and activities as directed by management. Works with facilities maintenance personnel and vendors/contractors to complete tasks and generates purchase requisitions as needed. Maintain logs and records utilizing computerized maintenance management systems to track all work. Properly trouble-shoots and maintains utilities, production lines and/or batching/processing equipment. Coordinate with related parties in concentrate plant, CPS, and government to: To develop, implementation of safety and environmental program as required by Corporate and local regulations, especially site’s electrical network and equipmentTo plan and execute maintenance and engineering program, especially site’s electrical network and associated equipment.Keep and maintain a high level of facilities and utilities of the plant.
Responsible for maintaining electrical distribution system including B-3 connection / installation.
Qualification & Requirements DAE / B-Tech ElectricalHaving Certificate of Certified Electrical Inspector (CEI) is a plus10+ years' experience in manufacturing maintenance with prior diagnostic, troubleshooting, and preventative maintenance experience are needed. Manufacturing experience required; maintenance experience is preferred.Ability to operate a manual/powered pallet jack or lift product is preferred.Working knowledge of hand and power tools.Able to read one-line diagrams, blueprints, and schematics.Ability to read and comprehend instructions and procedures.Visual ability to monitor, identify and detect ingredient, container, and equipment problems.Valid certificate to work on LT / HT panels & installationQuality Systems KnowledgeOperation of diesel generatorsHands on experience on instrumentation problem solvingKnowledge of working in food industryKnowledge of GMPAbility to record information.Ability to move at least 65 lbs. a distance of 5ft. Manual dexterity to manipulate small objects.Ability to stand and perform repetitive motions for extended periods (2 hours). 
What We Can Do For You Purpose Driven: Purpose driven approach that empowers our people to protect the environment and communities we serve while delivering safe & quality products. Large & Connected Network: Ability & exposure to cross-functional connected teams across the country & globe allow you to enhance and maintain global connections that allow us to move faster and learn from others.Community of Belonging: We’re an organization that believes our ability to continually grow and build the right atmosphere where people feel safe and empowered, lets you bring your best self to work. 
SkillsHydraulics; Forklift License (Inactive); Pneumatic; Fabrication (Inactive); Electrical Systems; Hand Tools; Programmable Logic Controller (PLC); HVAC Systems; Welding; Mechanical Maintenance; Power Tools; Reading Schematics; Electrical Management; Lubrication Systems; Industrial Installations; Blueprints; Preventive MaintenanceOur Purpose And Growth CultureWe are taking deliberate action to nurture an inclusive culture that is grounded in our company purpose, to refresh the world and make a difference. We act with a growth mindset, take an expansive approach to what’s possible and believe in continuous learning to improve our business and ourselves. We focus on four key behaviors – curious, empowered, inclusive and agile – and value how we work as much as what we achieve. We believe that our culture is one of the reasons our company continues to thrive after 130+ years. Visit Our Purpose and Vision to learn more about these behaviors and how you can bring them to life in your next role at Coca-Cola.We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. About the job
            

 
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?Are you a software engineer that thrives on complex challenges and is eager to make a real impact? Join our team where you'll be contributing to our strategic product line, that’s looking to reshape industries and change the way people work and learn.Our strategic product line includes: Crossover: An AI-powered hiring platform that sifts through millions of applicants per year to find the top 1% of global remote talent. We're breaking down geographical barriers and making high-paying jobs accessible to professionals worldwide, regardless of their location.gt.school: An online education platform that uses advanced data collection, algorithms, and AI-generated content to empower students to learn at their own pace. Our adaptive learning system fills knowledge gaps, accelerates learning, and helps students master a whole grade level on a subject within weeks.Data-driven Sales: This initiative leverages data and AI algorithms to streamline the sales process across a portfolio of over 100 software products. We're transitioning these products to a unified platform based on Salesforce and NetSuite, all while handling complex data imports, synchronization, modeling divergences and data inconsistencies.
What we offer: The opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies, including the latest in AWS serverless and no-code/low-code patterns.The opportunity to learn and experiment with using generative AI to boost your productivity.A team of exceptionally talented engineers from around the world as your peers.The chance to work on products that are reshaping industries and making a difference in people's lives.
We're not just using AI as a buzzword. We're at the start of a thrilling journey with generative AI, experimenting and learning to fully leverage its potential and free our engineers from mundane tasks, allowing them to focus on what truly matters: design, decision-making, and understanding the far-reaching implications of different implementation strategies.Showcase your skills, not just your resume. Take on our challenges: 15-min Cognitive, 90-min Coding, 120-min Technical Decision-Making. Excel and you'll face a decisive interview with our Hiring Manager. More than half walk away with an offer. Ready to unleash your potential? Apply today!What You Will Be Doing Developing cloud-native backends and implementing data processing algorithms using the latest serverless cloud patterns, including AWS.Review code to ensure adherence to best practices, team standards, and customer requirements.
What You Won’t Be Doing Spending time on minor bug fixes or features in outdated codebases.Dealing with tedious infrastructure to keep poorly written products running.Getting stuck in endless meetings discussing roadmaps and priorities or chasing people around.
Basic RequirementsSoftware Development Engineer key responsibilities At least 4 years of experience writing production code for the server side of web applications.At least 2 years of experience being the primary technical contributor for a development team OR software product.At least 1 year of hands-on experience developing using cloud patterns (any cloud vendor).An openness to learn to use generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.
Nice-to-have Requirements Experience in using generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.
About TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next: You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us: First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

Job Title: Full Stack DeveloperEmployment Type: Full-timeExperience Level: Mid-level (5 years of experience)  We are currently seeking a talented Full Stack Developer with expertise in Typescript and Javascript, React, React Native, Next.js, Tailwind CSS, SCSS, Nest.js, TypeORM, Node.js, Express.js, and Postgres, and Oracle database to join our dynamic team. Job Description: As a Full Stack Developer, you will play a crucial role in building and maintaining web and applications that are both visually appealing and high-performing. You will work closely with our cross-functional teams to bring innovative solutions to life, leveraging your deep knowledge of both front-end and back-end technologies. Key Responsibilities:  Full Stack Development: Develop and maintain web applications, covering both front-end and back-end, ensuring they meet high standards of performance, security, and user experience. Front-End Development: Utilize your expertise in React, Next.js, Tailwind CSS, and SCSS to create visually stunning and responsive user interfaces.Back-End Development: Leverage your experience in Nest.js, TypeORM, Node.js, and Express.js and Nest.js to build robust and scalable server-side components.Database Management: Work with Oracle database to design, optimize, and maintain the database schema, ensuring data integrity and performance.Architecture and Design: Collaborate on architectural decisions and design patterns to create scalable and maintainable applications.Code Quality: Write unit tests, conduct code reviews, and adhere to best practices to maintain code quality and reliability.Collaboration: Collaborate closely with designers, product managers, and fellow developers to deliver high-quality solutions on time.
 ·        Node.js: A strong understanding of Node.js is fundamental. This includes asynchronous programming, event-driven architecture, and knowledge Java and TypeScript are crucial for both front-end and back-end development. Knowledge of modern JavaScript ES6+ features is essential.·        Server-Side Development: Expertise in building server-side applications using Node.js, including creating APIs, handling HTTP requests, and managing databases.·        Front-End Development: Proficiency in front-end technologies like HTML, CSS, and JavaScript frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, or Vue.js) to create responsive and interactive user interfaces.·        Express.js: Knowledge of Express.js, a popular web application framework for Node.js, is essential for building robust server-side applications.·        Database Management: Proficiency in working with databases, both relational (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL) and NoSQL (e.g., MongoDB). Understanding of database design and optimization is important.·        RESTful APIs: Ability to design and implement RESTful APIs for communication between the front-end and back-end systems.·        Web Security: Knowledge of web security best practices to protect against common vulnerabilities like XSS, CSRF, and SQL injection.·        Package Management: Familiarity with package managers like npm or yarn for managing project dependencies.·        Version Control: Proficiency in using version control systems like Git for tracking code changes and collaborating with other developers.·        Build Tools: Experience with build tools and task runners (e.g., Webpack, Gulp) to automate tasks like bundling, minification, and deployment.·        Testing and Debugging: Skill in writing unit tests, integration tests, and performing debugging using tools like Mocha, Chai, and Jest, or debugging tools provided by browsers and Node.js.·        Deployment and DevOps: Knowledge of deploying Node.js applications on web servers or cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Heroku). Understanding of containerization (e.g., Docker) and orchestration tools (e.g., Kubernetes) can also be beneficial.·        Performance Optimization: Ability to identify and address performance bottlenecks in both front-end and back-end code.·        Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD): Understanding of CI/CD pipelines to automate the testing and deployment of code changes.·        Agile Development: Familiarity with Agile methodologies and practices for efficient project management and collaboration.·        Soft Skills: Effective communication, problem-solving, and teamwork skills are important, as full-stack developers often work closely with other team members and stakeholders.·        Security: Awareness of security best practices and the ability to implement security measures to protect applications and data.·        Project Management: Familiarity with project management tools and methodologies can be beneficial for organizing and tracking work.·        DevOps and Cloud Services: Knowledge of cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud and how to leverage DevOps practices for infrastructure management and scaling applications. Employment TypeFull-time

Job Desception:
About the job
            

 
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?At Trilogy, we're convinced that generative AI represents the future of coding. We see tools like Copilot, Cursor, and Code Interpreter as game-changers in the software industry, much like the Internet and Cloud Computing once were. Our vision is that significant portions of code that are written today tediously by hand will be mostly automated away by using generative AI.Why does this matter? Because with AI, you'll not only speed up the process of understanding and writing code but also produce standardized solutions, implement features more efficiently, experiment faster, and streamline testing. We believe developers working with this model will have a more rewarding job; they'll cover a broader scope and accomplish more in the same amount of time.This role is unique in our company. While our other engineering roles focus primarily on feature delivery, this position emphasizes developing a methodology for leveraging AI tools and patterns within the engineering process. The processes and methods you establish will benefit others, as they will be reused across teams.Besides this novel approach for your day-to-day work, you’ll also get a chance to work on some really exciting products: Crossover - an AI-powered hiring platform that sifts through millions of applicants per year to find the top 1% of global remote talent.gt.school - an online education platform that uses advanced data collection, algorithms, and AI-generated content to empower students to learn at their own pace.Data-driven Sales - an initiative that leverages data and AI algorithms to streamline the sales process across a portfolio of over 100 software products.
We're on the brink of an exhilarating journey with generative AI, and we want you to be a part of it. If you're eager to pioneer this transformation and play a pivotal role in the AI-driven future of software development, Trilogy is the place for you.What You Will Be Doing Proposing and conducting experiments with generative AI to enhance engineering processes, including problem decomposition, solution design, code generation, and advanced troubleshooting.Documenting best practices and techniques in playbooks and guides that enable others to harness the power of generative AI effectively.Using AI tools and techniques to develop and roll out actual features and products.Adopting, testing, and aggressively integrating new technologies, and standardizing a tech stack that genuinely boosts productivity.
What You Won’t Be Doing Developing completely new AI models - we are focusing our attention on reusing and/or finetuning existing models instead. Engaging in academic exercises without tangible outcomes or failing to deliver features and products.Getting stuck on a stagnant tech stack that neither changes nor innovates.
Basic RequirementsSoftware Engineer (AI-Powered Development) key responsibilities Minimum 5 years of experience in software development.Minimum 3 years as a primary technical contributor for a development team or software product.Extensive hands-on experience using generative AI for software engineering tasks or in a product you built.

Job Description: ·        Responsible to oversee and manage all risks associated with business and operational activities of the Company.·        Responsible to update risk structure and monitoring mechanism for credit, market, liquidity, and operational risk appetites and to develop and update policies in these areas.·        Act as Secretary to the Board Risk Committee and shall be responsible to update Board Risk Committee about company’s risk profile, risk appetite and ongoing risk management activities.·        Act as Secretary to the Credit and Risk Management Committee and shall be responsible to update the Committee on all credit and risk management activities on regular basis along with complete risk pack.·        Head of Risk shall work closely with the Senior Management and Risk Committee of the Board to develop and carry-out corporate strategic direction for Risk Management vis a vis business plan.·        Develop strategies for strengthening Risk Management framework of the Company.·        Devise effective Risk Management and reporting framework as per the nature, size, and complexity of business and in line with the Board’s approved strategies/polices.·        Develop various monitoring reports on Credit, Market, Liquidity and Operational Risk & generating & reviewing exceptions reports.·        Develop and review risk related policies and procedures on an ongoing basis to ensure that the policies correlate with the overall organizational objectives and risk management framework approved by the Board.·        Recommend all credit limits to the competent authorities for approval (Credit and Risk Management Committee and Board Risk Committee).·        Develop, manage, and update risk rating models.·        Review and recommend credit proposal submitted by Business.·        Ensure timely compliance with all regulatory requirements and timely submissions of all regulatory returns pertaining to Risk Management.·        Implement Basel III (Capital Adequacy) requirements as and when updated by SBP along with performing stress testing and periodically updating ICAAP.·        Review and recommend investment proposals received from Treasury to ALCO.·        Review and oversee Environment and Social Risk (E&S) in the mortgage portfolio of the partner financial institutions.  Eligibility:·       Ideal Candidate should be at least Masters’ preferably MBA or a related degree from reputable HEC recognized university with relevant certification.·        At least 15 years of experience in Risk Management Function in Financial Industry.·        The Candidate should be a professional who possess extensive and in-depth knowledge of Risk Management and FIs business activities, have understanding of Mortgage Market, experience of Corporate and FI credit approval process as well as knowledge of Market, Liquidity and Operational Risk. Good Analytical Skills.

Strategic Tax Planning: Optimize the direct tax position of the local Bayer legal entities while complying with local tax rules and international tax treaties. By that the job holder has to compile data to apply for timely renewal of exemption certificates for advance and withholding taxes collected from Bayer at source.Optimize the tax position of Bayer group companies undertaking transactions in Pakistan by obtaining exemption certificates in respect of payments to Bayer group companies, where possible.
2. Audit Defense and litigation support: Prepare replies to tax queries and coordinate tax audits conducted by tax authorities.Perform cost benefit analysis and thereafter file appeals related to tax assessments.Prepare updated tax positions in respect of pending assessments and make provisions, where appropriate, in the books of accounts.Monitor progress of tax cases in close coordination with external counsel.

6. Provide support in implementation of Bayer Group guidelines, policies, and directives in the local country/country group as far as taxation matters are concerned.7. Contribute local expertise to Transfer Pricing matters related to the country/country group.8. Where external advisors/auditors are involved, support and steer the external party in his/her work. Provide assistance to the Head of Taxes on other tax issues as and when required.

Our vision is love brands, done sustainably, for a better shared future. Our manufacturing teams are dedicated to bringing our brands to life and creating value for our customers, big and small. The Plant Technician role provides maintenance support to our plant operations to enable us to meet our quality standards & safety codes, and ensures we are executing our maintenance programs. The Plant Technician must identify, troubleshoot, and repair problems (mechanical, electrical, etc.), run tests, isolate problems, remove/replace failed components, determine failure modes by studying worn components, and perform other tasks, as required. We’re looking for a candidate with manufacturing experience that has a passion for details and ensure quality work and productsWhat You’ll Do For Us Performs skilled maintenance and repair services of facility or/and production plant systems such as mechanical, electrical and building or/and production line systems. Plans and conducts building repairs such as repair outdoor lighting, doors, drywall, and ceiling tiles. Installs insulation and plastic coverings on product lines and piping, perform light plumbing and repairs. Performs facility preventative maintenance programs as directed. Disassembles machinery and equipment to remove parts and make repairs, examines parts for defects such as breakage and excessive wear. Cleans, lubricates, and adjusts parts, equipment, and machinery. Perform preventative maintenance and clear jams on machines as neededPerforms building maintenance and troubleshooting to meet or exceed plant and departmental goals while ensuring tasks are completed in a safe manner to ensure achievement of Quality, Service, Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) and Cost Objectives. Complies with all standard operating procedures and requirements under CCR Quality System. Directs and tracks contractor needs, and activities as directed by management. Works with facilities maintenance personnel and vendors/contractors to complete tasks and generates purchase requisitions as needed. Maintain logs and records utilizing computerized maintenance management systems to track all work. Properly trouble-shoots and maintains utilities, production lines and/or batching/processing equipment.Overhaul pumps, motors, valves, conveyor belts and associated fittings and pipe linesCoordinate with related parties in concentrate plant, CPS, and government to: To develop, implementation of safety and environmental program as required by Corporate and local regulationsTo plan and execute maintenance and engineering programKeep and maintain a high level of facilities and utilities of the plant.

Qualification & Requirements DAE / B-Tech MechanicalHaving Certificate/Training of Mechanical Fabrication, Welding of SS and MS7+ years' experience in manufacturing maintenance with prior diagnostic, troubleshooting, and preventative maintenance experience are needed. Manufacturing experience required; maintenance experience is preferred.Ability to operate a manual/powered pallet jack or lift product is preferred.Working knowledge of hand and power tools.Working knowledge of Grinder, Drill Machines, Welding Plant and other fabrication toolsAble to read P&IDs, Fabrication Drawings, Design Drawings, blueprints, and schematics.Alignment of AgitatorsKnowledge of MHEs (Forklift, Hand-Palletizer etc.) MaintenanceAbility to read and comprehend instructions and procedures.Visual ability to monitor, identify and detect ingredient, container, and equipment problems.Quality Systems KnowledgeKnowledge of working in food industryKnowledge of GMPAbility to record information.Ability to move at least 65 lbs. a distance of 5ft. Manual dexterity to manipulate small objects.Ability to stand and perform repetitive motions for extended periods (2 hours). 
What We Can Do For You Purpose Driven: Purpose driven approach that empowers our people to protect the environment and communities we serve while delivering safe & quality products. Large & Connected Network: Ability & exposure to cross-functional connected teams across the country & globe allow you to enhance and maintain global connections that allow us to move faster and learn from others.Community of Belonging: We’re an organization that believes our ability to continually grow and build the right atmosphere where people feel safe and empowered, lets you bring your best self to work.

Job Desception:
About the job
            

 
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?Are you a software engineer that thrives on complex challenges and is eager to make a real impact? Join our team where you'll be contributing to our strategic product line, that’s looking to reshape industries and change the way people work and learn.Our strategic product line includes: Crossover: An AI-powered hiring platform that sifts through millions of applicants per year to find the top 1% of global remote talent. We're breaking down geographical barriers and making high-paying jobs accessible to professionals worldwide, regardless of their location.gt.school: An online education platform that uses advanced data collection, algorithms, and AI-generated content to empower students to learn at their own pace. Our adaptive learning system fills knowledge gaps, accelerates learning, and helps students master a whole grade level on a subject within weeks.Data-driven Sales: This initiative leverages data and AI algorithms to streamline the sales process across a portfolio of over 100 software products. We're transitioning these products to a unified platform based on Salesforce and NetSuite, all while handling complex data imports, synchronization, modeling divergences and data inconsistencies.
What we offer: The opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies, including the latest in AWS serverless and no-code/low-code patterns.The opportunity to learn and experiment with using generative AI to boost your productivity.A team of exceptionally talented engineers from around the world as your peers.The chance to work on products that are reshaping industries and making a difference in people's lives.
We're not just using AI as a buzzword. We're at the start of a thrilling journey with generative AI, experimenting and learning to fully leverage its potential and free our engineers from mundane tasks, allowing them to focus on what truly matters: design, decision-making, and understanding the far-reaching implications of different implementation strategies.Showcase your skills, not just your resume. Take on our challenges: 15-min Cognitive, 90-min Coding, 120-min Technical Decision-Making. Excel and you'll face a decisive interview with our Hiring Manager. More than half walk away with an offer. Ready to unleash your potential? Apply today!What You Will Be Doing Developing cloud-native backends and implementing data processing algorithms using the latest serverless cloud patterns, including AWS.Review code to ensure adherence to best practices, team standards, and customer requirements.
What You Won’t Be Doing Spending time on minor bug fixes or features in outdated codebases.Dealing with tedious infrastructure to keep poorly written products running.Getting stuck in endless meetings discussing roadmaps and priorities or chasing people around.
Basic RequirementsLead Software Engineer key responsibilities At least 4 years of experience writing production code for the server side of web applications.At least 2 years of experience being the primary technical contributor for a development team OR software product.At least 1 year of hands-on experience developing using cloud patterns (any cloud vendor).An openness to learn to use generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.
Nice-to-have Requirements Experience in using generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.
About TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next: You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us: First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.
