We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Senior Business Development Manager to drive growth and expansion in our portfolio and ERP implementation, cloud services, and license selling business. As a key member of our team, you will play a pivotal role in identifying new business opportunities, developing strategic partnerships, and driving revenue growth. Reporting directly to the Country Head, you will be responsible for crafting and executing business development strategies that align with our company's objectives and market trends. Key Responsibilities: 1. Market Analysis and Opportunity Identification: - Conduct in-depth market research to identify trends, emerging technologies, and potential growth areas related to portfolio/ERP implementation, cloud services, and license sales. - Analyze competitive landscape and identify key competitors, market positioning, and differentiators. - Identify and prioritize potential clients and target segments for business expansion. 2. Strategic Partnerships: - Establish and maintain strategic partnerships with software providers, cloud service providers, and relevant industry players to enhance our service offerings and market reach. - Collaborate with partners to develop joint value propositions, marketing strategies, and co-selling initiatives. 3. Business Development: - Develop and execute a comprehensive business development plan to achieve revenue targets and market penetration. - Identify and engage with potential clients, understanding their business needs, and tailoring solutions that align with their requirements. - Lead contract negotiations and close high-value deals with a focus on long-term partnerships. 4. Solution Customization: - Collaborate closely with the technical and solution teams to understand the capabilities of our portfolio, ERP implementations, cloud services, and licensing offerings. - Provide insights into customization and enhancement opportunities based on market feedback and client needs. 5. Sales Management: - Develop and manage a robust sales pipeline, tracking opportunities from initial engagement to closure. - Implement effective sales strategies, including pricing models, contract terms, and negotiation tactics. - Provide accurate sales forecasts and reports to the senior management team. 6. Team Collaboration: - Work closely with cross-functional teams, including marketing, product development, and customer support, to ensure a seamless end-to-end customer experience. - Provide mentorship and guidance to junior team members, sharing industry insights and best practices. Qualifications and Experience: - Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field (Master's degree preferred).- Proven track record of at least 7-10 years in business development, sales, and solution selling within the portfolio/ERP implementation, cloud services, and software licensing industry.- Strong understanding of enterprise software, cloud services, and technology licensing models.- Demonstrated experience in building and nurturing strategic partnerships.- Exceptional communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.- Analytical mindset with the ability to identify market trends and capitalize on opportunities.- Proven ability to work independently and drive results within a matrixed organizational structure. - Previous experience in team leadership or mentoring is a plus.

Job Desception:
About the job
            

 
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, gt.school. Have you got what it takes?Are you a software architect with an unwavering commitment to well-engineered code who thrives in the fast-paced world of AWS cloud computing? Do you relish the challenge of leading product development, crafting, and executing complex architectural decisions? If you're eager to push the boundaries of what's possible in tech, then gt.school is the right place for you!Traditional educational models are struggling to meet the diverse needs of today's learners. At gt.school, we're not just developing software; we're revolutionizing education to overcome this challenge. Our groundbreaking data platform, CoachBot, empowers students to learn independently, with no teacher or tutor required. Through tight integration with numerous learning apps, CoachBot harnesses the power of analytics to assess student performance, delivering targeted real-time feedback and encouraging progress with innovative motivational techniques - including cash rewards!What sets us apart? Our platform is 100% cloud-native, utilizing cutting-edge AWS technologies like Lambda, Step Functions, Glue, AppSync, and QuickSight. This means you'll spend less time maintaining old code and more time pioneering new solutions in a dynamic, ever-evolving tech landscape.We believe that technical leadership shouldn't mean "graduating" to administration and management - here, you'll always be at the forefront of technology, driving the design and development of new features. You’ll lead by example, delivering the most complex features and making the most challenging architectural decisions. You'll have the opportunity to inspire and shape a team of talented engineers, all while remaining hands-on and engaged with the technology you love.If you're a strategic thinker with a proven track record in software architecture and cloud technologies, and you're ready to redefine the future of education, we'd love to hear from you!What You Will Be Doing Masterminding architecture designs and translating complex requirements into comprehensive solutionsMaking the most important decisions required to support new product functionalityDeep-diving into system issues, identifying root causes and devising sustainable fixes
What You Won’t Be Doing Treating symptoms - you’ll get to the root cause and prevent issues from recurringBeing stuck managing resources or dealing with tedious HR tasksBeing confined to overseeing a single team or productBeing left out of the technical loop
Principal Software Architect Key Responsibilities Building an efficient engineering system that operates according to designs and playbooks, enabling continuous delivery of high-quality software releases
Basic Requirements 5+ years of experience in software development3+ years of experience in software architecture3+ years of experience developing using AWS cloud patterns
About Gt.schoolgt.school is a stealth EdTech startup in Austin, Texas, the center of educational innovation in the US. Our unique approach leverages 50+ years of learning science, cutting-edge data analytics and high-performance life skills coaching. In doing so, we can help students learn 5x faster and unlock their full potential in both academics and in life. We are a remote-first company that hires globally via Crossover.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $100 USD/hour, which equates to $200,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next: You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us: First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

Our platform is 100% cloud-native, utilizing cutting-edge AWS technologies like Lambda, Step Functions, Glue, AppSync, and QuickSight. This means you'll spend less time maintaining old code and more time pioneering new solutions in a dynamic, ever-evolving tech landscape.We believe that technical leadership shouldn't mean "graduating" to administration and management - here, you'll always be at the forefront of technology, driving the design and development of new features. You’ll lead by example, delivering the most complex features and making the most challenging architectural decisions. You'll have the opportunity to inspire and shape a team of talented engineers, all while remaining hands-on and engaged with the technology you love.If you're a strategic thinker with a proven track record in software architecture and cloud technologies, and you're ready to redefine the future of education, we'd love to hear from you!What You Will Be Doing Masterminding architecture designs and translating complex requirements into comprehensive solutionsMaking the most important decisions required to support new product functionalityDeep-diving into system issues, identifying root causes and devising sustainable fixes
What You Won’t Be Doing Treating symptoms - you’ll get to the root cause and prevent issues from recurringBeing stuck managing resources or dealing with tedious HR tasksBeing confined to overseeing a single team or productBeing left out of the technical loop
Lead Software Engineer Key Responsibilities Building an efficient engineering system that operates according to designs and playbooks, enabling continuous delivery of high-quality software releases
Basic Requirements 5+ years of experience in software development3+ years of experience in software architecture3+ years of experience developing using AWS cloud patterns

Job Desception:
About the job
            

 
Seeking a pivotal leadership role in Engineering and Maintenance where the key responsibilities will encompass overseeing the efficiency and compliance of plant machinery, formulating, and implementing maintenance strategies in line with business goals, project management, and issue resolution. A significant part of this strategic role will include leading value creation projects, fostering team growth, and promoting cross-functional collaboration. The role will also involve managing contracts, budgets, and proactive addressing of potential issues, all while maintaining the highest standards of safety, health, and environmental practices.Job SummaryWhat You’ll do for us: Management of the engineering and maintenance requirements to ensure optimum efficiency of plant and machinery and ensuring compliance to legislation and standards. The aim is to leverage equipment productivity, reliability and maintainability thereby enabling high plant availability and utilization at the lowest cost.To develop and sustain a maintenance policy that supports the company’s business strategy and also ensures improved process control and subsequently quality using digital tools / systems.Manage engineering projects & managing internal & external teams to accomplish their successful completion.Plan & direct the installation, testing, operation, maintenance, and repair of facilities & equipment.Further to this, the duties of this management position include: Involvement in process improvement type projectsPro-actively handling health and safety as well as environmental issues.Active participation with respect to Good Manufacturing Practices.Management of contracts involving engineering servicesManager engineering OPEX and capex spends within agreed budget.Manage capex process in line with company strategy and plant needs in short and long terms to make the most of capex investment, specifically with skills on capex estimations, budgeting & capability execute them on time.Mentor team of direct reports to constantly upgrade their skill and maintain high moral in the team.Interact effectively to central technical function in Atlanta on key areas and seek necessary support.Interact with peer cross functional leadership team members to support and seek support as necessary.Interact with local statutory bodies / government officials to seek necessary approvals and always maintaining 100% statutory compliance.Use looks at data to preempt issues and address them proactively. Ability to trouble shoot technical issues to provide support to the stakeholders spanning across all the functions.Work as an effective team player and a leader as required.Look at plant requirements with good business and financial acumen.Lead value creation projects for the business with creative technical solutions

Key Duties/Responsibilities Maintenance of the Plant and machinery using preventive maintenance systems and best practices.Coordinate & direct projects with respect to the initiation, design, and execution process.Initiate / lead / participate improvement projects with manufacturing.Actively contribute towards establishing and maintaining short- and long-term capital investment plans with respect to the facility masterplan.Cost control and adherence to the department operational budget.Preparation of the department’s annual budget.Leadership: – communicate, coach, and offer direction to the Technical Department associates as well as actively contribute towards their development and training.Ensure that the Engineering services associates are trained in new technology and equipment.Continually manage and develop performance standards for the department and conduct performance reviews.Ensure customer satisfaction – through providing support to the various departments within the facility.Execute projects with agreed timelines and budgets with adequate controls.Ensure compliance with respect to government legislation and company standards.Use digital tools techniques to enhance performance enhancement of the plant.Prepare and update site master planning.Asset care site capex planning and executionWorking with stakeholders in Central Technical function, Finance teamSupport site occupational safety and environment agendaLead manufacturing modernization agenda with industry 4.0 initiatives
Environmental Management, Occupational Health & Safety, and Food Safety & Quality Cooperate and follow instructions given by the employer, Commissioner of Labor, Inspector, or any other person lawfully authorized to give such instructions in keeping the working conditions safe and without risk to health and injury in the field of that activity.Ensure engineering controls to ensure compliance to Food Safety and Quality requirements.Proactively address any situation before it becomes unsafe or unhealthy, potential risk from Safety, Health, Environment or Quality perspective. Ensure that relevant Engineering, occupational health and safety, Food safety and quality procedures, work instructions, and work aids are operative and adhered to in their functional areas.Ensures that associates understand their responsibilities / trained adequately in the Engineering, occupational health and safety, food safety and Quality management systems.
Qualifications & Requirements Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering or related field.8-10 years of experience in FMCG environment leading projects at a manufacturing location. Mastery in project management with experience both in large and small projects. This should include actual experience in a manufacturing environment executing projects.Experience in capital budgeting, forecasting. Strong knowledge of SAP for capex management. Detail oriented, analytical, and creative thinker with passion to improve and digitize capex and project management work processes. Excellent project management, planning and organization skills and ability to work and deliver in changing environments while adhering to specified deadlines. PMP certification is preferred.Strong influencing and communication skills. Demonstrated ability to lead teams and get results in a matrixed organization. Knowledge of technical skills in FMCG industry needed. Experience in operations is preferred. Experience in Complex program management / implementation, influencing and communication skills in preferred.Detailed knowledge of capital project oversight including new equipment installation and vendor management.Strong interpersonal communication skills.
What We Can Do For You Leadership Development: Our Company’s purpose clearly speaks to the importance of leadership. We feel everyone has potential to be a great leader at Coca-Cola and have set the bar high.Total Rewards: Our benefits, called Total Rewards, is about the total value of working at The Coca-Cola Company. It is focused on the complete package of pay, benefits, learning and personal support you receive as a Coca-Cola employee.Learning & Development: At The Coca-Cola Company we believe innovation can't happen without continuous learning and we provide our employees many ways to grow professional and personally.
SkillsLeadership; Supply Chain; Lean Manufacturing; Research and Development Operations; Autodesk AutoCAD; Project Engineering; Lead Times; Food Processing; organization; Food Production; Timeline Development; Project Management; Packaging Supplies; Materials Handling; Programmable Logic Controller (PLC); Six Sigma; Process Engineering; Microsoft Office; Communication; Automation Engineering; Control Systems (Inactive)Our Purpose And Growth CultureWe are taking deliberate action to nurture an inclusive culture that is grounded in our company purpose, to refresh the world and make a difference. We act with a growth mindset, take an expansive approach to what’s possible and believe in continuous learning to improve our business and ourselves. We focus on four key behaviors – curious, empowered, inclusive and agile – and value how we work as much as what we achieve. We believe that our culture is one of the reasons our company continues to thrive after 130+ years. Visit Our Purpose and Vision to learn more about these behaviors and how you can bring them to life in your next role at Coca-Cola.We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. When we collect your personal information as part of a job application or offer of employment, we do so in accordance with industry standards and best practices and in compliance with applicable privacy laws.R-94552

You will oversee the software engineering team's activities, ensuring the successful delivery of high-quality software solutions that harness the power of Generative AI and blockchain and Web2 technologies. Your expertise in software engineering, combined with your ability to mentor and motivate a team, will be essential in achieving our ambitious goals.Responsibilities: Report to and collaborate closely with the VP of Engineering to define the technical roadmap, goals, and priorities for the software engineering team, aligning them with the company's vision and objectivesProvide technical expertise and guidance in areas such as machine learning, deep learning, smart contracts, consensus algorithms, and decentralized applications (DApps).Ensure adherence to best practices in software development, code quality, testing, and deployment processes.Conduct regular performance evaluations, identify skill gaps, and provide training and professional development opportunities for the team members.Lead and manage a team of highly skilled software engineers, providing technical guidance, mentorship, and fostering a culture of collaboration and innovation.Ensure the successful delivery of software projects, adhering to best practices in software engineering, code quality, testing, and deployment processes.Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers, designers, and researchers, to define requirements, prioritize features, and deliver high-quality products on time.Drive continuous improvement initiatives within the software engineering team, identifying areas for improvement in processes, tools, and technologies.Develop and maintain a talent acquisition and retention strategy, actively participating in the recruitment and onboarding of top engineering talent.Provide ongoing performance evaluations, feedback, and career development support to team members, fostering their growth and professional development.Foster a positive and inclusive team culture, promoting effective communication, knowledge sharing, and collaboration.Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in software engineering, generative AI, and blockchain technologies, and proactively identify opportunities for improvement and innovation within our technical stack.
Requirements: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. Advanced degree preferred.8-10 years of experience with software product development, who is still hands-on and heavily involved in the entire SDLC. 4-5 years of experience managing, leading and mentoring technical teams in a fast-paced, agile environment pertaining to product development.Excellent python programming skills and knowledge of the python ecosystem including Django, Flask, and FastAPI.Understanding of Frontend technologies and frameworks, client server architecture, microservices, cloud based scalable architecture. multi tenant architecture.Interest in Blockchain technologies (e.g., Ethereum, Hyperledger Fabric), Smart Contracts, Decentralized systems, and Blockchain development frameworks.Understanding of Artificial Intelligence (AI), Computer Vision, Machine Learning/ML Ops would be a plus.Proven experience with Web2 software development principles, including modern frontend and backend technologies, microservices, RESTful APIs, and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).Experience with DevOps practices, continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD) pipelines, and containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to navigate complex technical challenges and make data-driven decisions.Excellent communication and leadership skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.Ability to mentor and guide junior team membersAdaptability and ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environmentContinuous learning mindset and willingness to stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies.

 Job Title: Inverter Repair Technician Job Overview: We are seeking a skilled Inverter Repair Technician to diagnose, troubleshoot, and repair issues with the Voltronic Power model inverters. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of electrical systems, be proficient in using diagnostic tools, and possess the ability to work independently to identify and fix inverter-related problems. Responsibilities: Inspect and assess malfunctioning inverters to determine the root cause of issues. Use diagnostic tools and equipment to identify electrical and electronic faults within the inverters. Repair or replace faulty components, such as circuit boards, capacitors, and other electronic parts. Test and calibrate inverters after repairs to ensure proper functionality and adherence to specifications. Address error codes and troubleshoot power output fluctuations, connection failures, and other operational problems. Follow safety protocols and guidelines when handling electrical components and working with high-voltage systems. Maintain accurate records of repairs performed, parts used, and diagnostic findings. Keep up-to-date with the latest technological advancements in inverter systems and repair techniques. Collaborate with other team members to share knowledge and expertise, especially in complex repair scenarios. Qualifications: High school diploma or equivalent; additional technical certifications or training in electronics/electrical systems is a plus. Proven experience in repairing and troubleshooting inverters, preferably with expertise in the Voltronic Power model. Strong knowledge of electrical principles, electronic components, and circuitry. Proficiency in using diagnostic tools, multimeters, and oscilloscopes. Ability to read and interpret technical schematics and diagrams. Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Physical stamina and dexterity to handle and repair equipment. Safety-conscious mindset when working with electrical systems.

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Salesforce Developer with a strong architectural background to lead the design and development of world-class Salesforce applications for our evolving CRM requirements. As a Senior Salesforce Developer, you will play a pivotal role in architecting solutions, implementing best practices, and ensuring optimal performance of Salesforce applications.Responsibilities:1. Architectural Design and Planning: Design and architect scalable, efficient, and high-performing Salesforce solutions to meet business requirements.Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into technical requirements and architectural designs.Define system architecture, components, modules, interfaces, and data flow for Salesforce applications.
2. Technical Expertise: Demonstrate a deep understanding of Salesforce Security, Secure Apex coding, and Apex design patterns.Provide expertise in integrating Salesforce with other systems and technologies to ensure seamless data flow and process automation.
3. Customization and Development: Develop and customize complex solutions within the Salesforce platform, utilizing Apex, Visualforce, and Lightning Web Components (LWC).Implement best practices for Salesforce development, ensuring code reusability, maintainability, and performance optimization.
4. Leadership and Collaboration: Lead and mentor a team of Salesforce developers, providing guidance, technical expertise, and fostering a culture of continuous improvement.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align architectural decisions with business objectives and technological strategy.
5. Quality Assurance and Testing: Ensure the stability, functionality, and security of Salesforce applications through rigorous testing and quality assurance procedures.Conduct code reviews and enforce coding standards to maintain code quality and reduce technical debt.
6. Documentation and Training: Create comprehensive technical documentation, including architecture diagrams, design specifications, and developer guides.Provide technical training and knowledge sharing sessions to Salesforce development teams and stakeholders.
7. Problem Solving and Troubleshooting: Analyze and troubleshoot complex software issues, identifying root causes and implementing effective solutions.Collaborate with support teams to address escalated technical issues and provide timely resolutions.
8. Process Optimization: Streamline development processes in an agile, iterative environment to enhance efficiency and productivity.Optimize Salesforce application development methodologies to improve delivery timelines and resource utilization.
9. Performance Tuning: Monitor and optimize the performance of Salesforce applications, identifying bottlenecks and implementing improvements for enhanced user experience.
10. Security Compliance: Ensure compliance with security standards and regulations, implementing measures to safeguard sensitive data within Salesforce applications.
Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in computer science or software engineering.Minimum 5-8 years of relevant working experience in Salesforce application and software development.Proven experience in architecting and designing complex Salesforce solutions.Expertise in Salesforce CRM platforms, including advanced knowledge of Salesforce security features and best practices.Proficient in MYSQL, Apex, JavaScript, Native, Visualforce, and Lightning Web Components (LWC).Working knowledge of development tools like MavensMate or Eclipse.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.Strong problem-solving abilities with a focus on high-level software and application challenges.Ability to set timelines, define development goals, and deliver high-quality solutions.
Employee Benefits: 13 Salaries Per Year (One Additional salary as a bonus)At least two bonuses per year (Eid Bonus)Performance-Based BonusesQuarterly Leaves EncashmentMonthly Regularity AllowanceMonthly Inflation AllowanceMaternity LeavesMedical Insurance(IPD+Maternity)Wedding AllowanceAnnual Leaves EncashmentProvident FundDouble salary on Gazetted HolidaysSpecial Allowance for Emergency12 Casual Leaves10 Medical Leaves10 Annual LeavesDedicated TrainingBirthday celebrationsLoan Against Provident FundAdvance Salary on Need BasisH-1 US Visa by EmployerDaily Company Provided MealGaming FacilityGrowing & Dynamic TeamOffice Gatherings, Celebrations, and Trips5 days a week (work-life balance)

Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, GFI Software. Have you got what it takes?Are you a senior software engineer known for successfully delivering product releases? Do you thrive in challenging environments and possess the strategic mindset to guide teams toward success? If this resonates with you, GFI Software has an exceptional opportunity: step into a leadership role and spearhead transformative projects that redefine the frontiers of software engineering.The industry often overlooks the dynamic and diverse SMB segment; at GFI, we're pioneering a different path. We focus exclusively on SMBs, offering tailored IT tools that provide tangible impacts, creating a stimulating and rewarding work environment.In this role, you will be responsible for driving product releases and ensuring quality deliveries within time, budget, and defined scope. You will develop cutting-edge networking and communications solutions and leverage your expertise in C++ to architect innovative software. Unlike typical managerial positions, you will actively participate in technical decision-making, as well as coaching, thriving on both hard and soft skills.As part of a collaborative and dedicated team, you'll drive strategic execution, make data-driven impacts, and spark innovation by encouraging exploration of new tools and methods for improvement. This role is a gateway to continuous learning and growth, where you will learn advanced networking techniques and security-first software design.If you're a senior engineer with the right mix of technical prowess, leadership, and passion for innovation, don't miss this chance to join us at GFI. Apply now and make your mark on the software engineering landscape!What You Will Be Doing Organizing and ensuring the quality and timely delivery of product releases within defined scope and budgetServing as the technical leader for GFI's engineering team, making critical decisions on software implementationCoaching the C++ software engineers on both hard and soft skills, fostering professional growth and team cohesion
What You Won’t Be Doing Micro-managing - at GFI, you won't be bogged down with micromanaging but will instead focus on strategic leadershipStagnating in technology - you won't be stuck working on outdated technologies; you'll drive cutting-edge solutionsFocusing on larger enterprises - we are dedicated to providing software solutions for small and medium-sized businesses
Senior C++ Engineer key responsibilitiesBasic Requirements 7+ years of professional experience in C++ development2+ years of experience in either the network communications or security domainDemonstrated experience in leadership and mentoringA grasp of AI, Large Language Models (LLMs), and prompt engineering, including Chain-of-Thought (CoT) prompting and Self-Consistency in CoT
About GFI SoftwareGFI Software develops essential applications for small and medium businesses. Over 80,000 customers choose GFI solutions for network management and performance, security, and collaboration applications. GFI Software available through thousands of channel partners dedicated to serving specific countries and regions worldwide.GFI has a fully remote, global workforce. GFI has partnered with Crossover to administer its hiring and global workforce management.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next: You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us: First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

Job Desception:
About the job
            

 
Grafana Labs is looking for Commercial Account Executive who will be responsible for prospecting and closing new business across the APAC region. You will identify, nurture and close opportunities with both new and existing customers, manage forecasts and track customer data. We're strong proponents of a consultative sales approach - learn about the customer's needs first before talking products. Your expertise will be critical in helping articulate the value of our products, work with the customer during the trial phase and hand off a strong relationship to our Customer Success team. Ideally, you come from a technical background and have sold technical products before.Responsibilities Meet and exceed individual quarterly and annual sales goalsManage all aspects of the sales process (prospecting, sales meetings, product demos, proofs of concept, proposals, negotiations and account management)Cultivate sales through outbound prospecting and inbound leadsBe able to understand and convey the value of both Grafana Cloud and Grafana EnterpriseBecome an expert in managing your sales pipeline in SalesforceManage quote creation, order processing, and day-to-day customer requests
Requirements Must be located in Singapore1+ Years of Experience in Infrastructure Technology SalesDemonstrated history of consistent goal achievement in a highly competitive environment (top 10% performer)Energetic, upbeat, entrepreneurial, tenacious team playerAdaptable and with demonstrable experience in high velocity technology companiesExperience using SalesforceFamiliarity with open source technology is a significant advantageYou will need to be an excellent communicator in all channels (in person, online, in writing) and able to form strong working relationships both in person and virtuallyExperience using Command of the Message and MEDD(P)ICC is ideal
About Grafana Labs: There are more than 950,000 active installations of Grafana around the globe, monitoring everything from beehives to climate change in the Alps. The instantly recognizable dashboards have been spotted everywhere from a NASA launch and Minecraft HQ to Wimbledon and the Tour de France. Grafana Labs also helps companies including Bloomberg, JPMorgan Chase, and eBay manage their observability strategies with full-stack offerings that can be run fully managed with Grafana Cloud, or self-managed with Grafana Enterprise Stack. The Grafana stack has grown to include four other open source projects, Grafana Loki (for logs), Grafana Tempo (for traces), Grafana Mimir (for metrics), and Grafana OnCall (for on-call management).Benefits: For more information about the perks and benefits of working at Grafana, please check out our careers page.Equal Opportunity Employer: At Grafana Labs we’re building a company where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, stay, and do their best work. We know that our company runs on the hard work and the dedication of our passionate and creative employees. If you're excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways.We will recruit, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, disability, age, veteran status, and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and unique. We believe that equality and diversity builds a strong organisation and we’re working hard to make sure that’s the foundation of our organisation as we grow.For information about how your personal data is used once you’ve applied to a job, check out our privacy policy.

Job Desception:
About the job
            

 
We are seeking an exceptionally talented Senior Graphic Designer to become a part of Team Taskaler.As a Senior Graphic Designer, you will hold the key to understanding and transforming creative briefs into captivating graphics and illustrations. The ideal candidate will be responsible for conceptualizing creative designs for a wide array of media to fit the needs of internal teams and external clients. Your mission: to craft visually stunning and impactful design materials that cater to the branding, merchandising, advertising, and marketing aspirations of our clients.The candidate we're seeking is not just proficient but truly immersed in the world of graphic design, equipped with a deep understanding of the latest graphic tools and software. Your portfolio should be more than just a showcase; it should be a testament to your design prowess, a visual narrative of your journey in the realm of corporate aesthetics and digital creativity. Your passion for curating compelling visual stories should be your driving force, inspiring and elevating our projects to new heights.If you have a meticulous eye for detail, a deep appreciation for design aesthetics, and the creative vision to bring every pixel to life, we invite you to connect with us. Join our team, and together, we'll create designs that not only leave a lasting impression but also spark the imagination. ResponsibilitiesGraphic Design: Design and produce a wide array of media. Craft visually captivating and innovative designs for a diverse range of marketing collateral, encompassing brochures, flyers, banners, infographics, social media posts, website graphics, advertisements, print media, product packaging, and email campaigns. Inject fresh, audience-centric concepts that leave a lasting impact.Project Management: Oversee design and production of all online and offline marketing material to ensure the designs are completed in a timely manner. Manage multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring deadlines are met, resources are allocated effectively, and client expectations are exceeded.Branding: Work closely with clients to understand their branding guidelines and ensure all design work aligns with their brand identity and messaging.Brand Consistency: Ensure that all design work strictly adheres to brand guidelines and maintains brand consistency. Brand etiquette is non-negotiable, and consistency is critical for brand recognition and credibility.Photo Editing: Retouch and manipulate photos to enhance their quality and appeal.Illustrations: Create custom illustrations or vector artwork as needed to support design projects.Typography: Apply principles of typography to designs, ensuring that fonts and text placement are visually appealing and legible.Digital Graphics: Design graphics tailored for websites, email campaigns, and social media platforms to enhance online presence and engagement.Video Creation and Editing: Lead video content creation, aligning with brand messaging for YouTube, podcasts, reels, and more. Manage end-to-end video production, ensuring quality, deadlines, and engagement. Occasionally guide junior designers in video editing.Print Materials: Develop print-ready files for various materials, including business cards, posters, and promotional materials.Collaboration: Collaborate with internal teams, including marketing and content teams, to understand project requirements, brainstorm ideas, and deliver creative solutions.Client Communication: Communicate effectively with clients to understand their design needs, present design concepts, and incorporate feedback into final designs. Collaborate closely with clients and team leads to understand their marketing goals, target audience, and product or service offerings. Translate this understanding into effective visual communication.Technical Proficiency: Stay proficient in graphic design software and tools, keeping up with the latest updates and advancements in design technology.Adaptability: Be adaptable and able to tailor designs to suit different marketing channels, such as adapting print designs for digital platforms or vice versa and optimising visuals for mobile devices.Quality Control: Ensure the quality and accuracy of all design materials produced, including proofreading for errors.Art Direction: Provide art direction for photo shoots, video production, or other visual projects, including selecting photographers, equipment, and props to achieve desired visuals.Budget Management: Occasionally, participate in budget management for design-related expenses, such as stock photos, software subscriptions, or outsourced resources like print services or media suppliers.Market Research: Stay up to date with industry trends, competitors' strategies, and emerging design techniques. Apply this knowledge to create innovative and competitive design solutions. Keep up to date with design trends, tools, and software to maintain high-quality design standards.Qualifications Bachelor's degree in graphic design or a related field or equivalent experience in Graphic Design3+ years' of creative design experienceExpertise in graphic design and editing software, including the latest Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Premiere, After Effects, etc.)Certification in graphic design or related fields is a noteworthy advantage.Strong typography skills
Preferred Qualifications: Competency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) for document, spreadsheet, and presentation template design and editing.Capability to integrate graphic design elements into Microsoft Office documents, producing visually appealing and professional materials.Familiarity with web design principles and UX/UI concepts.Basic knowledge of HTML and CSS.Experience in creating animations and video editing.Understanding of 3D modelling and rendering software.

About the job
            

 
OverviewWorking at AtlassianAtlassians have flexibility in where they work – whether in an office, from home, or a combination of the two. That way, Atlassians have more control over supporting their family, personal goals, and other priorities. We can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company.This is a remote position. With 4 hour+ timezone overlap with the team, we're able to hire eligible candidates for this role from any location in Australia and New Zealand.Your future teamYou will operate within the Talent Management pillar of the Talent Team and report to the Head of Talent Management. You will collaborate with the other Talent Partners and HRBPs, focusing on delivering enterprise wide Talent solutions and also partnering with the Engineering function to deliver engineering specific talent programs.Most of the current team members are spread across Australia Eastern time zone and US Pacific timezone.We are reimagining our annual performance management process and its an exciting time to be part of the team that's shaping and driving this change for the enterprise.ResponsibilitiesWhat you'll do Design and implement inclusive strategies , programs and processes to assess, manage and measure equitable outcomes for the organisations workforce.Lead organisation talent processes such as performance management, promotions, talent review, career management, and succession planning to ensure they are data-driven and aligned to ongoing strategic imperatives in the business.Manage the maintenance and execution of our talent management frameworks including job and growth profiles, and performance evaluation instruments.Draw on employee data and analytics, and benchmark analyses, to inform talent management priorities and employee experience design.Research trends and changes in workforce management to develop effective, inclusive, and equitable talent management strategies.Ensure practices are integrated with other people process across the full employee lifecycle.Define and track success measures for talent management programs including change managementStay informed on the latest thinking on performance management, skill and competency frameworks and and bring practices to Atlassian, to increase the impact of our own strategies
QualificationsYour background Advanced degree in Industrial/Organisational Psychology, or related preferred experience in and demonstrated subject matter expertise in performance management & assessment design, change management, employee experience design8+ years of relevant experience leading Talent Management projects or processes and developing creative Talent Management solutionsExcellent project management skills, and creating connected talent management strategies that help a team-based, global workforceStrong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a data-driven and evidence-based approach to decision-making, enabling you to collaborate with different stakeholders to develop effective solutions to issues.Demonstrated ability to impact the direction of your team’s work productDemonstrated customer focus, including experience developing an understanding of business structure, people, processes, and technology to guide business-aligned designDemonstrated ability to collaborate across multiple departments
Our Perks & BenefitsAtlassian offers a variety of perks and benefits to support you, your family and to help you engage with your local community. Our offerings include health coverage, paid volunteer days, wellness resources, and so much more. Visit go.atlassian.com/perksandbenefits to learn more.About AtlassianAt Atlassian, we're motivated by a common goal: to unleash the potential of every team. Our software products help teams all over the planet and our solutions are designed for all types of work. Team collaboration through our tools makes what may be impossible alone, possible together.We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians create our success. To ensure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience, we never discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.To provide you the best experience, we can support with accommodations or adjustments at any stage of the recruitment process. Simply inform our Recruitment team during your conversation with them.To learn more about our culture and hiring process, visit go.atlassian.com/crh .

You will collaborate with the other Talent Partners and HRBPs, focusing on delivering enterprise wide Talent solutions and also partnering with the Engineering function to deliver engineering specific talent programs.Most of the current team members are spread across Australia Eastern time zone and US Pacific timezone.We are reimagining our annual performance management process and its an exciting time to be part of the team that's shaping and driving this change for the enterprise.ResponsibilitiesWhat you'll do Design and implement inclusive strategies , programs and processes to assess, manage and measure equitable outcomes for the organisations workforce.Lead organisation talent processes such as performance management, promotions, talent review, career management, and succession planning to ensure they are data-driven and aligned to ongoing strategic imperatives in the business.Manage the maintenance and execution of our talent management frameworks including job and growth profiles, and performance evaluation instruments.Draw on employee data and analytics, and benchmark analyses, to inform talent management priorities and employee experience design.Research trends and changes in workforce management to develop effective, inclusive, and equitable talent management strategies.Ensure practices are integrated with other people process across the full employee lifecycle.Define and track success measures for talent management programs including change managementStay informed on the latest thinking on performance management, skill and competency frameworks and and bring practices to Atlassian, to increase the impact of our own strategies

About the job
            

 
Micro Focus (now OpenText) is one of the world’s largest enterprise software providers. We deliver mission-critical technology and supporting services that help thousands of customers worldwide manage core IT elements of their business so they can run and transform—at the same time.The OpportunityWe are now looking for a seasoned Fortify Technology Consultant to join our team in Saudi, as part of the Emerging Markets (EM) region Cyber Resilience (CyberRes) Professional Services (PS) team. The CyberRes PS team provides engineering services that spans the Micro Focus’ CyberRes portfolio.In this role, you will work collaboratively with Fortify consultants, Managing Principals and Directors to deliver cutting edge services on client engagements with a world class team from around the globe. You will be accountable for deploying Fortify solutions to satisfy client business requirements and assist customers to utilise Fortify to its full potential.In this role you will forge strong relationships with customers and provide them with solid advice on the Fortify product and be seen as a subject matter expert. Other duties would include installation of Fortify software, business requirements workshops, troubleshooting, performing on-going scans so the clients realise the true value of product.This job isn’t just about installing software and making it work; it’s about delivering the knowledge to our customers so that they can continue to utilise Fortify long after you leave client site. An important aspect of this role is understanding cyber security operations and how to utilise Fortify to perform daily cyber security operations tasks.What It Takes Perform on-going automated security code review scans using SCA via integration with other build and bug systems.Review the automated SCA findings and mark them as vulnerable or false positives before publishing the SCA findings on Fortify Software Security Center (SSC) to End-User.Customer developers Provide clarification to End-User Customer developer queries on SCA reported vulnerabilities and their remediation. Review & assess End-User Customer developer comments for false positives in SCA reports. Track & report remediation of SCA reported findings on End-User Customer applications. Perform regular installation and maintenance of Fortify plugins on End-User Customer developer IDEs .Perform regular installation and maintenance of Fortify SCA on End-User Customer developer machines and train them on how to run SCA scans & push the findings to End-User Customer SSC from their local SCA installations. Lead & implement new End-User Customer DevOps integration requirements. Perform on-going resolution of SCA and SSC technical issues such as but not limited to: SCA scanning & reporting issues SCA and SSC integration issues with Jenkins & JiraProvide monthly activity report outlining the completed tasks within the month Regularly review, assess, and ensure that the existing Fortify software are operational and stable. Handle all the required configurations on the integrated systems with Log Management and SIEM solutions. Perform sprint of Application Security Infrastructure Revision to identify potential performance bottlenecks or conditions that could adversely impact availability or reliability and provide recommendations for resolving such issues. Aptitude to solve issues and ensure timely delivery of solutions that meet customer expectations Provide technical consulting and advice to customer on-site efforts Assist in design enterprise-scale projects for Micro Focus Fortify solutions and products Deliver world-class consulting to some of the largest companies in the world Promotes Knowledge Management (KM) and fosters a KM culture through both reuse and contribution
You are great at Experience working within the information and cyber security fieldExperience working with Application security solutions, preferably FortifyHands on experience with deployment, integration, and training of Micro Focus Fortify.Experience with security devices (e.g. Firewall, IDS and web proxies etc.) will be a plus.Experience with UNIX, Linux, and Windows operating systemKnowledge of other Micro Focus Security platforms such as ArcSight, Voltage, or NetIQ will be a plusA good understanding of databasesGood technical writing skills A security certification such as CISSP, CISM, CEH, SANS is preferableWillingness and ability to travel
